instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> waters damage, consuming 0.02A
threads.message:
i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

SCL/SDA lines of battery bus 0.565.
SMC/<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 0.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 0.6v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>. 0.3v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.56v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 1.2v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 0.2V

board dont start on bypass smc

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> waters damage, consuming 0.02A
threads.message: I recommend you to reball SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> waters damage, consuming 0.02A
threads.message:
ok, SMC Reballed
<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> replaced 

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5.1v
SMC/<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>. 3.3v

but still 0.02A
sometimes it jumps to 0.10 
still no power

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> waters damage, consuming 0.02A
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
when charger is connected, or manualy trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
i have 5V should appear at L7520 if i remove <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR>.

threads.message: Try new SMC from 00165 donor board.

threads.message: Liquid damage, tried to be repaired by someone before me

threads.message: Ah so that sucks. Any idea where liquid was by?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> waters damage, consuming 0.02A
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> voltages; 23, 22, 29, 12, 13, 21.
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for reaction (drop pulse) at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.
If yes, then check for pulse at all <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SX_L</SIGNAL> signals.

Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
